name: C++ Unordered Set
description: C++ <unordered_multimap> are associative containers that store elements formed by the combination of a key value and a mapped value, much like unordered_map containers, but allowing different elements to have equivalent keys (C++11 only)

Capacity.val: Returns a bool value indicating whether the unordered_set container is empty, i.e. whether its size is 0
Returns the number of elements in the unordered_set container
Returns the maximum number of elements that the unordered_set container can hold

Iterators.val: Returns an iterator pointing to the first element in the unordered_multimap container or in one of its buckets
Returns an iterator pointing to the past-the-end element in the unordered_multimap container or in one of its buckets
Returns a const_iterator pointing to the first element in the unordered_multimap container or in one of its buckets
Returns a const_iterator pointing to the past-the-end element in the unordered_multimap container or in one of its buckets

Element Lookup.val: Searches the container for an element with k as key and returns an iterator to it if found, otherwise it returns an iterator to unordered_multimap::end
Searches the container for elements whose key is k and returns the number of elements found
Returns the bounds of a range that includes all the elements in the container with a key that compares equal to k

Modifiers.val: Inserts a new element in the unordered_multimap
Inserts a new element in the unordered_multimap container with hint
Inserts new elements in the unordered_multimap
Removes from the unordered_multimap container either the elements whose key is k or those in a range ([first,last))
All the elements in the unordered_multimap container are dropped: their destructors are called, and they are removed from the container, leaving it with a size of 0
Exchanges the content of the container by the content of umm, which is another unordered_multimap object containing elements of the same type

Buckets.val: Returns the number of buckets in the unordered_multimap container
Returns the maximum number of buckets that the unordered_multimap container can have
Returns the number of elements in bucket n
Returns the bucket number where the elements with key k are located

Hash Policy.val: Returns the current load factor in the unordered_multimap container
Returns the current maximum load factor for the unordered_multimap container
Sets z as the new maximum load factor for the unordered_multimap container
Sets the number of buckets in the container to n or more
Sets the number of buckets in the container (bucket_count) to the most appropriate to contain at least n elements

Observers.val: Returns the hash function object used by the unordered_multimap container
Returns the key equivalence comparison predicate used by the unordered_multimap container
Returns the allocator object used to construct the container

Non Member Function Overloads.val: These overloaded global operator functions perform the appropriate equality or inequality comparison operation between the unordered_multimap containers lhs and rhs
The contents of container lhs are exchanged with those of rhs
